text:
Interesting but fairly obvious result of doing some linear regressions with different ind variables, if i say choose the price 10seconds earlier as a parameter the regression then determines the best fit is 0.99 the price 10seconds earlier, not  unsurprising i guess,but also not so independent..
But then if you use values totally independent of price,eg volume, wom,.. then the fit is naturally aweful and useless

elements.text:

text: I don't understand you <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> - it does not matter whether you use python, pandas, R etc - linear regression is linear regression. You've invested the time learning to use pandas what possible benefit is there switching now? Regression results will be shit if your explanatory variables are not right. Not everything has a linear relationship and not all response variables are well suited to linear regression.

text: You can fit linear regression to any data but it might not be the right thing to do. You can take data from a quadratic curve and fit a straight line to it but there is no point because it isn't linear. You can solve for the parameters of gradient and intercept that minimise the error but that line is as much use as a waterproof teabag when it comes to describing your data points.

elements.text: You can fit linear regression to any data but it might not be the right thing to do. You can take data from a quadratic curve and fit a straight line to it but there is no point because it isn't linear. You can solve for the parameters of gradient and intercept that minimise the error but that line is as much use as a waterproof teabag when it comes to describing your data points.

text: A plot of x against y will give you a visual idea of whether there is a linear relationship between the two. Bindly fitting straight lines to data that is not linear is pointless.

elements.text: A plot of x against y will give you a visual idea of whether there is a linear relationship between the two. Bindly fitting straight lines to data that is not linear is pointless.

text: <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> Just my opinion, but you don't seem to spend anywhere near enough time analysing any of your ideas. text: Life is very non-linear, and quite multi-dimensional. Here’s by tip for you <@U01PJ5YMFBJ>: What is your theory? What hypothesis are you testing? Read up on data mining. Success, in my view will come from accurately modeling behaviour of either runners or punters. If you don’t have a view on what behaviour you are examining you’ll be staying on that bicycle.
